translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs of Threads🔽The Text on the Pairs of Threads in the Order of Arising

original: 18.28. Saraṇaduka, Mahantaradukādi🔽Saraṇaṁ sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo nasārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Araṇaṁ sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo nasārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saraṇaduka mahantaraduka ādi  saraṇam sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  araṇam sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na sa araṇaḥ na sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The Pairs of Threads on the Refuges, the Great Triad, and so on🔽With a refuge and with a decisive-support that is a mental datum, a non-refuge and a non-decisive-support that is a mental datum arises with a condition being a root-cause condition.🔽With a non-refuge and with a decisive-support that is a mental datum, a non-refuge and a non-decisive-support that is a mental datum arises with a condition being a root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… aññamaññe ekaṁ …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe aññamaññe ekam pe vipāke ekam pe avigate dve
translated: With a root-cause, there are two … with a prenascence, one … with a kamma, one … with an absence, two. (Abbreviated.)
